description: Tool-type-specific PubMed queries for NF research tools mining

bench_science.description: Primary query for computational tools, animal models, PDX, organoids, cell lines
filters: NOT case*[Title/Journal] NOT review[Title] NOT pain[Title] NOT tomography[Title]
NOT outcomes[Title] NOT individiual*[Title] NOT patient*[Title] NOT population[Title]
NOT clinic*[Title] NOT cohort*[Title] NOT child*[Title] NOT current[Title] NOT MRI*[Title]
NOT guideline*[Title] NOT perspective*[Title] NOT retrospective[Title] NOT after[Title]
NOT "quality of life"[Title] NOT pediatric*[Title] NOT adult*[Title] NOT resection[Title]
NOT parent*[Title] NOT prognostic[Title] NOT surg*[Title] NOT facial[Title] NOT giant[Title]
NOT prevalence[Title] NOT experience[Title] NOT famil*[Title] NOT presentation[Title]
NOT trial[Title] NOT "novel mutation"[Title] NOT presenting[Title] NOT overview[Title]
NOT pregnancy[Title] NOT lady[Title] NOT female[Title] NOT woman[Title] NOT women[Title]
NOT "hearing loss"[Title] NOT "pictorial essay"[Title] NOT healthcare[Title] NOT CT[Title]
NOT "rare occurence"[Title] NOT update*[Title] NOT initiative*[Title] NOT male[Title] NOT social[Title]
NOT people[Title] NOT decision*[Title] NOT autopsy*[Title] NOT isolated[Title] NOT solitary[Title]

clinical_assessment.description: Query for clinical assessment tools, questionnaires, patient-reported outcomes
filters: (neurofibromatosis[MeSH Terms] OR neurofibromatosis type 1[Text] OR NF1[Text] OR MPNST[Text]
OR plexiform neurofibroma[Text] OR cutaneous neurofibroma[Text])
clinical_assessment.notes: Clinical studies publish less frequently than bench science. Run quarterly to capture patient outcome studies.

organoid_focused.description: Optional targeted query for organoid/3D culture studies if not captured by bench query
organoid_focused.notes: Use only if organoid extraction remains at 0% after bench science query. May not be needed.

steps: 3. Run organoid_focused query only if needed (check bench results first)
4. Deduplicate PMIDs across queries (same paper in multiple queries is OK)
5. Mine all papers with appropriate tool type expectations
6. Merge results by publication (one publication can have multiple tool types)

implementation_notes.deduplication: A paper can appear in multiple queries - that's expected. Deduplicate at the publication level, not query level.
implementation_notes.cost_optimization: Clinical query returns fewer papers and should be run less frequently (quarterly vs monthly).
implementation_notes.monitoring: Track tool extraction rate by query type to validate query effectiveness.
implementation_notes.validation: If clinical_assessment extraction rate stays <5%, revisit query filters.
